group_1.textCenter: Huh? What's this posted up on the board?@A newspaper?

group_1.narration: The main draw of the Gossip Club I started:@The Midori Report.

group_1.textCenter: "Chemistry Class Gets Positive Reaction"@Is this article about me?

group_1.narration: It covers everything from tiny, everyday@events to big incidents and their culprits.

group_1.textLeft: Bullying in class? Even a teacher was in on@it...

group_1.textRight: Whoa. There's so many photos, it's gotta be@true.

group_1.narration: I never included my own opinions.@My only concern was getting the truth out.@This school paper is written by me, for me.

group_1.textCenter: What the hell is this?! These are all lies!

group_1.textLeft: Ripping it up and throwing it away just makes@him look more guilty.

group_1.textRight: Too true. The teacher's probably seen this@too, right?

group_1.textCenter: Damn it!

group_1.narration: The Midori Report was posted where everyone@could see it, students and teachers alike.

group_1.textCenter: (The first issue went great.)
(And I already have more scoops for the next@issue.)
(I have to get the next one out while people@are still churned up...)

group_1.textRight: Ryo! So YOU'RE the one who's using the@bulletin board without permission!
The whole school read your lies!

group_1.textLeft: Look at this photo, for example.
This one's also true. And I have way more@where that came from.
Leave me alone, and I won't publish them.@For now.
(So he's doing these things knowing that@he could get into deep trouble...)

group_1.narration: The teacher may have been angry with me,@but that wasn't enough to faze me.
I continued releasing The Midori Report...

group_1.textCenter: Kitty cats, kitty cats! Today's entry in the@Kitty Cat Calendar is...

group_1.textRight: Huh?! Where did that little shrew take this@shot?!

group_1.narration: For better or worse, The Midori Report@became a famous fixture at@Minaminagi Liberty Academy.

group_1.textCenter: Hmm... Seems like I got more fan mail today.
(What's this one here? "Snitches get@stitches.")
(Someone needs to update their insults.)

group_1.narration: Since I snapped photos of people doing all@kinds of bad things, it made perfect sense@that a lot of people came to hate me.

group_1.textCenter: (This one... "Thank you so much.")
(Not that I'm really doing anything that@deserves thanks, but...)

group_1.narration: Just like that letter, there were@also people who thanked me.
Both the resentment and the appreciation@proved I was getting the truth out there.
But I still didn't really feel better.

group_1.textCenter: *Exhale*
(One wrong move and it's all over.)
(Magical Girl duties are no walk in the@park...)
(And yet no one has any clue that we're@doing this.)

group_1.narration: I knew there was something bothering me.
Magical Girls risk their@lives fighting each day...
But barely anyone knows about it.

group_1.textCenter: (That's not all, either.)

group_1.narration: We girls in the East are risking our lives@for girls in the West who scorn us!

group_1.textCenter: *Sigh* Turns out I'm just as naive as anyone@else.

group_1.narration: I couldn't deny how I felt. That resentment@had been smoldering away, deep in my heart.
And I was irritated by the fact that I was@resentful about it. I had sworn to myself...
I would use my powers to spread the truth, but@I felt like my determination was threatened.

group_1.textCenter: All right, then!
(The next issue is gonna be about Magical@Girls and Witches!)
